result.execSummary:
The defendant Breion Shequille Woodson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the  DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/2025.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: AS TO EACH COUNT, COUNT ONE AND TWO:  Concurrent with count two in 15CF1024.  Credit for 180  days, 3/2/2015 to 8/28/2015.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or posession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant not to possess  cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.  Defendant may may not have more than one phone number registered to your  name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept.
Defendant may not work in a place where a firearm is kept.  
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with Michael C. dob 12/1/1989; Jovan C. dob 6/26/1999.

Under Section 973.049, Court finds and prohibits contact with Brentniesha P.-N. as they were both coactors and witnesses in the crime in count two and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Notify DOC agent of all prescription within three business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescrption at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent and notify DOC agent of the pharmacy used.
Complete parenting or fatherhood course, if any minor children.
Participate in a cognitive behavior progam or cognitive intervention program.
Fine set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: firearm posssesion and voting.

Court advised defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entrie bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of those conditins may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as listed in count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breion Shequille Woodson

Exhibit list from sentencing hearing, received and filed.

Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Exhibit 1 received. 

AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS, concurrent with count 2 in 15CF1024, with credit for 180 days (3-02-2015 to 08-28-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 29 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 in 15CF1024, with credit for 180 days (03-02-2015 to 08-28-2015)time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 19 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later then 12-31-2025; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not work in a place where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.  
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Michael C.  (DOB 12-01-1989).
- No contact with Jovan C.  (DOB 06-26-1999).
- No contact with any person in the video (Sentencing hearing, Exhibit 1), with the exception of any minor children. 
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Brentniesha P-N. as they were both co-actors and witnesses in the crime in COUNT 2 and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course (if any minor children). 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program  or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;

Court REITERATES that the defendant has No Contact with Brentniesha P-N and No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
At the hour of 10:38 pm the jury returned and by their foreperson returned as verdict as follows:
" We the jury, find the defendant, Breion Woodson, guilty of possessing a firearm after being adjudicated delinquent of a felony level offense, as charged in Count 1 of the information." 
" We, the jury, find the defendant, Breion Woodson, guilty of possession with Intent to deliver a controlled substance, cocaine, as a party to a crime, as charged in Count 2 of the information.  Was the amount of cocaine, including the weight of any other substance or material mixed or combined with it, possessed with intent to deliver more than 40 grams? (Before you may answer this question "yes," you must be satisfied beyond a reasonable doubt that the amount was more than 40 grams) yes "
Court polls the jury. Court discharged panel. 
Upon motion of the state, court entered judgments of conviction as to counts 1 and 2. Defendant is REMANDED. State moves to have defendants contact privileges revoked. Defense objects. Court grants state's motion and orders defendant's custodial telephone, visitation and U.S. mail privileges, while the defendant remains in custody during this prosecution rescinded with the exception of any communications with his and/or with Judge Stark. 
  
Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, the victim  and the defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 48 hours in advance of the sentencing. Case is adjourned for sentencing on 08-28-2015 at 10:00 am, branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.
Received and filed.

Trial continued.  Defense motions to include lesser charge on verdict forms. Court denies defense motion. Jury in the box. Court instructed the jury Closing arguments by the state and defense. Court charged the jury. Alternate juror selected by lot and released. 
 Jury retired at the hour of 4:00 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies  who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury out of the box. Jury question received and filed. Case recalled. Jury in the box. Jury out of the box. Jury in the box. Court instructed the jury and release for the evening and to at 9:00 am.

Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Jury out of the box at 11:18 am. Case recalled. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to testify.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense motion for f state's case denied by the court. Defense rests. Jury in the box at 11:42 am. State and defense rest. Testimony closed. Court instructed the jury. Jury released for lunch and to return by 1:15pm.

Jury release for the evening. Jury out of the box at 4:50 pm. Side bar placed on the record.

Defendant Breion Shequille Woodson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul Hauer for Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Cash bail remains as previously set at $10,000 with the following conditions:  
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision, GPS monitoring, 24 hours curfew with release for verified court dates and verified attorney appointments at 819 N. 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol. No contact with Brentniesha P-N, Michael C., and Jovan C. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms, firearm magazine, firearm holster, firearm ammunition, or body armor. Defendant may not live in a house where a firearm is kept nor ride in a vehicle where a firearm is kept. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Reduction of Bail, received and filed.

Defense requests to be heard on bail at the next court date. Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Arraignment scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
